VI.iii.1.B.2.l
.
Deciding Whether Continuation of the Apportionment Is Appropriate
After taking the actions described in
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, 1.B.2.k
,
establish EP(s) 130, using the payee code(s) for the dependent(s) with whom the Veteran was
not
reunited, and
send a letter to the dependent(s) with whom the Veteran was
not
reunited.  In the letter,
remind the dependent(s) the apportionment VA granted based on the Veteran’s incarceration was temporary and subject to discontinuance when incarceration ended
ask the dependent(s) to complete and return
VA Form 21-0788
within 30 days, and
inform the dependent(s) that VA will continue the apportionment only upon receipt of evidence/information showing an apportionment is still warranted.
Follow the instructions in the table below after the
earlier
of the following occurs:
the dependent(s) responds to the letter, or
the 30-day response period expires.
Step
Action
1
Did the dependent respond to the request for completion of
VA Form 21-0788
?
If
yes
, go to Step 3.
If
no
, go to the next step.
2
Discontinue the apportionment effective the date in the LAST PAID DATE field on the CURRENT AND HISTORICAL AWARD INFORMATION page in VBMS.
Go to Step 12.
Note
:  If the dependent returns
VA Form 21-0788
after
VA discontinues the apportionment, follow the instructions in
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, 1.B.2.m
.
3
Determine whether a bar to the apportionment now exists.
Note
:  A bar to an apportionment of a Veteran’s benefits exists under any of the circumstances described in
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart iii, 1.A.1.f
.
4
Does a bar to the apportionment exist?
If
yes
, go to the next step.
If
no
, go to Step 6.
5
Discontinue the apportionment effective the date in the LAST PAID DATE field on the CURRENT AND HISTORICAL AWARD INFORMATION page in VBMS.
Go to Step 12.
6
Does the evidence of record
at the present time
suggest an
increase
in the amount of the apportionment might be in order?
If
yes
,
clear an EP 130 under the Veteran’s name, and
go to Step 9.
If
no
, go to the next step.
7
Establish EP 130 under the Veteran’s name, using the current date as the date of claim.
8
Send a letter to the Veteran requesting a completed and returned
VA Form 21-0788
within 30 days.
Unless the provisions of
38 CFR 3.450
are
not
for consideration in determining whether the dependent(s) remain entitled to an apportionment, inform the Veteran in the letter that if they are not contributing to the claimant’s support, they must provide VA with an explanation for not doing so.
Go to Step 10 after the
earlier
of the following occurs:
the Veteran responds, or
the 30-day response period expires.
9
Take the actions described in Steps 9-11 of the table in
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart iii, 1.A.2.a
.
Go to the next step after the
earlier
of the following occurs:
the Veteran responds to the notice of proposed adverse action, or
the 65-day response period expires.
Notes
:
Minor revisions to the notice of proposed adverse action referenced in
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart iii, 1.A.2.c
, will be necessary to clarify that VA is proposing to increase the amount of the existing apportionment.
Follow the instructions in
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart iii, 1.A.2.f
, if the Veteran requests a hearing within 30 days of the date of the notice of proposed adverse action.
10
Follow the instructions in
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart iii, 1.A.3.a-g
.
11
Follow the instructions in the table below.
If …
Then document the decision according to the instructions in M21-1, Part VII, Subpart iii, 1.A.3.g, and …
VA decides to continue the apportionment at its
present
rate
go to Step 12.
VA decides
apportionment of the Veteran’s compensation is no longer warranted, or
a reduction in the apportionment is warranted
discontinue or reduce the apportionment effective the date in the LAST PAID DATE field on the CURRENT AND HISTORICAL AWARD INFORMATION page in VBMS, and
go to Step 12.
VA decides an increase in the amount of the apportionment is warranted
pay the increased amount effective the date VA reduced the apportionment to its present level (based on the reduction described in Step 1 of the procedure outlined in
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, 1.B.2.k
), and
go to the next step.
Important
:  Do
not
increase the amount of the apportionment without first taking the actions described in
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart iii, 1.A.2.b and c
.
12
Notify the Veteran and the dependent of VA’s decision.
Reference
:  For more information about notifying beneficiaries and claimants of a decision regarding an apportionment, see
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart iii, 1.A.3.m
.  (The exception in the referenced block does
not
apply in this situation.)
title: M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section B - Paying Benefits to the Dependent(s) of an Incarcerated Veteran
